t: Psalm 1
The Two Ways
How*pn happy is the one who does not walk*ln in the advice of the wicked or*ln stand in the pathway with sinners or*ln sit in the company of mockers!
Instead,*ln his delight is in the Lord’s*s instruction, and*ln he meditates on it day and night.
He*ln is like a tree planted beside flowing streams that*ln bears its fruit in its season, and*ln its leaf does not wither. Whatever*ln he does prospers.
The*pn wicked are not like this; instead,*ln they are like chaff that the wind blows away.
Therefore*ln the wicked will not stand up in the judgment, nor*ln sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
For*pn the Lord*s watches over the way of the righteous, but*ln the way of the wicked leads to ruin.
Psalm 2
Coronation of the Son
Why*pn do the nations rage and*ln the peoples plot in vain?
The*ln kings of the earth take their stand, and*ln the rulers conspire together against*ln the Lord*s and his Anointed One:
“Let’s*ln tear off their chains and*ln throw their ropes off of us.”
The*pn one enthroned in heaven laughs; the*ln Lord ridicules them.
Then*ln he speaks to them in his anger and*ln terrifies them in his wrath:
“I*ln have installed my king on*ln Zion, my holy mountain.”
I*pn will declare the Lord’s*s decree. He*ln said to me, “You are my Son; today*ln I have become your Father.
Ask*ln of me, and*ln I will make the nations your inheritance and*ln the ends of the earth your possession.
You*ln will break them with an iron scepter; you*ln will shatter them like pottery.”
So*pn now, kings, be wise; receive*ln instruction, you judges of the earth.
Serve*ln the Lord*s with reverential awe and*ln rejoice with trembling.
Pay*ln homage to the Son or he will be angry and*ln you will perish in your rebellion, for*ln his anger may ignite at any moment. All*ln who take refuge in him are happy.
Psalm 3
Confidence in Troubled Times
A psalm of David when he fled from his son Absalom.
Lord,*spn how my foes increase! There*ln are many who attack me.
Many*ln say about me, “There*ln is no help for him in God.” Selah*ig
But*pn you, Lord,*s are a shield around me, my*ln glory, and the one who lifts up my head.
I*ln cry aloud to the Lord,*s and*ln he answers me from his holy mountain. Selah*ig
I*pn lie down and sleep; I*ln wake again because the Lord*s sustains me.
I*ln will not be afraid of thousands of people who*ln have taken their stand against me on every side.
Rise*pn up, Lord!*s Save*ln me, my God! You*ln strike all my enemies on the cheek; you*ln break the teeth of the wicked.
Salvation*ln belongs to the Lord;*s may*ln your blessing be on your people. Selah*ig
Psalm 4
A Night Prayer
For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.
Answer*pn me when I call, God,*ln who vindicates me. You*ln freed me from affliction; be*ln gracious to me and hear my prayer.
How*pn long, exalted ones, will my honor be insulted? How*ln long will you love what is worthless and*ln pursue a lie? Selah*ig
Know*ln that the Lord*s has set apart the*ln faithful for himself; the*ln Lord*s will hear when I call to him.
Be*ln angry and do not sin; reflect*ln in your heart while on your bed and be silent. Selah*ig
Offer*ln sacrifices in righteousness and*ln trust in the Lord.*s
Many*pn are asking, “Who can show us anything good?” Let*ln the light of your face shine on us, Lord.*s
You*pn have put more joy in my heart than*ln they have when their grain and new wine abound.
I*ln will both lie down and sleep in peace, for*ln you alone, Lord,*s make me live in safety.
Psalm 5
The Refuge of the Righteous
For the choir director: with the flutes. A psalm of David.
Listen*pn to my words, Lord;*s consider*ln my sighing.
Pay*ln attention to the sound of my cry, my*ln King and my God, for*ln I pray to you.
In*pn the morning, Lord,*s you hear my voice; in*ln the morning I plead my case to you and watch expectantly.
For*pn you are not a God who delights in wickedness; evil*ln cannot dwell with you.
The*ln boastful cannot stand in your sight; you*ln hate all evildoers.
You*ln destroy those who tell lies; the*ln Lord*s abhors violent and treacherous people.
But*pn I enter your house by*ln the abundance of your faithful love; I*ln bow down toward your holy temple in*ln reverential awe of you.
Lord,*sln lead me in your righteousness because*ln of my adversaries; make*ln your way straight before me.
For*pn there is nothing reliable in what they say; destruction*ln is within them; their*ln throat is an open grave; they*ln flatter with their tongues.
Punish*ln them, God; let*ln them fall by their own schemes. Drive*ln them out because of their many crimes, for*ln they rebel against you.
But*pn let all who take refuge in you rejoice; let*ln them shout for joy forever. May*ln you shelter them, and*ln may those who love your name boast about you.
For*ln you, Lord,*s bless the righteous one; you*ln surround him with favor like a shield.
Psalm 6
A Prayer for Mercy
For the choir director: with stringed instruments, according to Sheminith. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn do not rebuke me in your anger; do*ln not discipline me in your wrath.
Be*ln gracious to me, Lord,*s for I am weak; heal*ln me, Lord,*s for my bones are shaking;
my*ln whole being is shaken with terror. And*ln you, Lord-*s how long?
Turn,*pn Lord!*s Rescue me; save*ln me because of your faithful love.
For*ln there is no remembrance of you in death; who*ln can thank you in Sheol?
I*pn am weary from my groaning; with*ln my tears I dampen my bed and*ln drench my couch every night.
My*ln eyes are swollen from grief; they*ln grow old because of all my enemies.
Depart*pn from me, all evildoers, for*ln the Lord*s has heard the sound of my weeping.
The*ln Lord*s has heard my plea for help; the*ln Lord*s accepts my prayer.
All*ln my enemies will be ashamed and shake with terror; they*ln will turn back and suddenly be disgraced.
Psalm 7
Prayer for Justice
A Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning the words of Cush, a Benjaminite.
Lord*spn my God, I seek refuge in you; save*ln me from all my pursuers and rescue me,
or*ln they will tear me like a lion, ripping*ln me apart with no one to rescue me.
Lord*spn my God, if I have done this, if*ln there is injustice on my hands,
if*ln I have done harm to one at peace with me or*ln have plundered my adversary without cause,
may*ln an enemy pursue and overtake me; may*ln he trample me to the ground and*ln leave my honor in the dust. Selah*ig
Rise*pn up, Lord,*s in your anger; lift*ln yourself up against the fury of my adversaries; awake*ln for me; you*ln have ordained a judgment.
Let*ln the assembly of peoples gather around you; take*ln your seat on high over it.
The*ln Lord*s judges the peoples; vindicate*ln me, Lord,*s according*ln to my righteousness and my integrity.
Let*pn the evil of the wicked come to an end, but*ln establish the righteous. The*ln one who examines the thoughts and emotions is*ln a righteous God.
My*ln shield is with God, who*ln saves the upright in heart.
God*ln is a righteous judge and*ln a God who shows his wrath every day.
If*pn anyone does not repent, he*ln will sharpen his sword; he*ln has strung his bow and made it ready.
He*ln has prepared his deadly weapons; he*ln tips his arrows with fire.
See,*pn the wicked one is pregnant with evil, conceives*ln trouble, and gives birth to deceit.
He*ln dug a pit and hollowed it out but*ln fell into the hole he had made.
His*ln trouble comes back on his own head; his*ln own violence comes down on top of his head.
I*pn will thank the Lord*s for his righteousness; I*ln will sing about the name of the Lord*s Most High.
Psalm 8
God’s Glory, Human Dignity
For the choir director: on the Gittith. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn our Lord, how*ln magnificent is your name throughout the earth! You*ln have covered the heavens with your majesty.
From*ln the mouths of infants and nursing babies, you*ln have established a stronghold on*ln account of your adversaries in*ln order to silence the enemy and the avenger.
When*pn I observe your heavens, the*ln work of your fingers, the*ln moon and the stars, which*ln you set in place,
what*ln is a human being that you remember him, a*ln son of man that you look after him?
You*ln made him little less than God and*ln crowned him with glory and honor.
You*ln made him ruler over the works of your hands; you*ln put everything under his feet:
all*ln the sheep and oxen, as*ln well as the animals in the wild,
the*ln birds of the sky, and*ln the fish of the sea that*ln pass through the currents of the seas.
Lord,*spn our Lord, how*ln magnificent is your name throughout the earth!
Psalm 9
Celebration of God’s Justice
For the choir director: according to Muth-labben. A psalm of David.
I*pn will thank the Lord*s with all my heart; I*ln will declare all your wondrous works.
I*ln will rejoice and boast about you; I*ln will sing about your name, Most High.
When*pn my enemies retreat, they*ln stumble and perish before you.
For*ln you have upheld my just cause; you*ln are seated on your throne as a righteous judge.
You*ln have rebuked the nations: You*ln have destroyed the wicked; you*ln have erased their name forever and ever.
The*ln enemy has come to eternal ruin; you*ln have uprooted the cities, and*ln the very memory of them has perished.
But*pn the Lord*s sits enthroned forever; he*ln has established his throne for judgment.
And*ln he judges the world with righteousness; he*ln executes judgment on the nations with fairness.
The*ln Lord*s is a refuge for the persecuted, a*ln refuge in times of trouble.
Those*ln who know your name trust in you because*ln you have not abandoned those*ln who seek you, Lord.*s
Sing*pn to the Lord,*s who dwells in Zion; proclaim*ln his deeds among the nations.
For*ln the one who seeks an accounting for*ln bloodshed remembers them; he*ln does not forget the cry of the oppressed.
Be*pn gracious to me, Lord;*s consider*ln my affliction at the hands of those who hate me. Lift*ln me up from the gates of death,
so*ln that I may declare all your praises. I*ln will rejoice in your salvation within*ln the gates of Daughter Zion.
The*pn nations have fallen into the pit they made; their*ln foot is caught in the net they have concealed.
The*ln Lord*s has made himself known; he*ln has executed justice, snaring*ln the wicked by*ln the work of their hands. Higgaion. Selah*ig
The*pn wicked will return to Sheol— all*ln the nations that forget God.
For*ln the needy will not always be forgotten; the*ln hope of the oppressed will not perish forever.
Rise*pn up, Lord!*s Do not let mere humans prevail; let*ln the nations be judged in your presence.
Put*ln terror in them, Lord;*s let*ln the nations know they are only humans. Selah*ig
Psalm 10
Need for God’s Justice
Lord,*spn why do you stand so far away? Why*ln do you hide in times of trouble?
In*ln arrogance the wicked relentlessly pursue their victims; let*ln them be caught in the schemes they have devised.
For*pn the wicked one boasts about his own cravings; the*ln one who is greedy curses and despises the Lord.*s
In*ln all his scheming, the*ln wicked person arrogantly thinks, “There’s*ln no accountability, since*ln there’s no God.”
His*ln ways are always secure; your*ln lofty judgments have no effect on him; he*ln scoffs at all his adversaries.
He*ln says to himself, “I will never be moved — from*ln generation to generation I will be without calamity.”
Cursing,*ln deceit, and violence fill his mouth; trouble*ln and malice are under his tongue.
He*ln waits in ambush near settlements; he*ln kills the innocent in secret places. His*ln eyes are on the lookout for the helpless;
he*ln lurks in secret like a lion in a thicket. He*ln lurks in order to seize a victim; he*ln seizes a victim and drags him in his net.
So*ln he is oppressed and beaten down; helpless*ln people fall because of the wicked one’s strength.
He*ln says to himself, “God has forgotten; he*ln hides his face and will never see.”
Rise*pn up, Lord*s God! Lift up your hand. Do*ln not forget the oppressed.
Why*ln has the wicked person despised God? He*ln says to himself, “You will not demand an account.”
But*ln you yourself have seen trouble and grief, observing*ln it in order to take the matter into your hands. The*ln helpless one entrusts himself to you; you*ln are a helper of the fatherless.
Break*ln the arm of the wicked, evil person, until*ln you look for his wickedness, but*ln it can’t be found.
The*pn Lord*s is King forever and ever; the*ln nations will perish from his land.
Lord,*sln you have heard the desire of the humble; you*ln will strengthen their hearts. You*ln will listen carefully,
doing*ln justice for the fatherless and the oppressed so*ln that mere humans from the earth may terrify them no more.
Psalm 11
Refuge in the Lord
For the choir director. Of David.
I*pn have taken refuge in the Lord.*s How*ln can you say to me, “Escape*ln to the mountains like a bird!
For*ln look, the wicked string bows; they*ln put their arrows on bowstrings to*ln shoot from the shadows at the upright in heart.
When*ln the foundations are destroyed, what*ln can the righteous do?”
The*pn Lord*s is in his holy temple; the*ln Lord*s —his throne is in heaven. His*ln eyes watch; his*ln gaze examines everyone.
The*ln Lord*s examines the righteous, but*ln he hates the wicked and*ln those who love violence.
Let*ln him rain burning coals and sulfur on the wicked; let*ln a scorching wind be the portion in their cup.
For*ln the Lord*s is righteous; he loves righteous deeds. The*ln upright will see his face.
Psalm 12
Oppression by the Wicked
For the choir director: according to Sheminith. A psalm of David.
Help,*pn Lord,*s for no faithful one remains; the*ln loyal have disappeared from the human race.
They*ln lie to one another; they*ln speak with flattering lips and deceptive hearts.
May*ln the Lord*s cut off all flattering lips and*ln the tongue that speaks boastfully.
They*ln say, “Through our tongues we have power; our*ln lips are our own - who can be our master?”
“Because*pn of the devastation of the needy and*ln the groaning of the poor, I*ln will now rise up,” says the Lord.*s “I*ln will provide safety for the one who longs for it.”
The*pn words of the Lord*s are pure words, like*ln silver refined in an earthen furnace, purified*ln seven times.
You,*pn Lord,*s will guard us; you*ln will protect us from this generation forever.
The*ln wicked prowl all around, and*ln what is worthless is exalted by the human race.
Psalm 13
A Plea for Deliverance
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
How*pn long, Lord?*s Will you forget me forever? How*ln long will you hide your face from me?
How*ln long will I store up anxious concerns within me, agony*ln in my mind every day? How*ln long will my enemy dominate me?
Consider*pn me and answer, Lord*s my God. Restore*ln brightness to my eyes; otherwise,*ln I will sleep in death.
My*ln enemy will say, “I have triumphed over him,” and*ln my foes will rejoice because I am shaken.
But*pn I have trusted in your faithful love; my*ln heart will rejoice in your deliverance.
I*ln will sing to the Lord*s because*ln he has treated me generously.
Psalm 14
A Portrait of Sinners
For the choir director. Of David.
The*pn fool says in his heart, “There’s no God.” They*ln are corrupt; they do vile deeds. There*ln is no one who does good.
The*ln Lord*s looks down from heaven on the human race to*ln see if there is one who is wise, one*ln who seeks God.
All*ln have turned away; all*ln alike have become corrupt. There*ln is no one who does good, not*ln even one.
Will*pn evildoers never understand? They*ln consume my people as they consume bread; they*ln do not call on the Lord.*s
Then*pn they will be filled with dread, for*ln God is with those who are righteous.
You*ln sinners frustrate the plans of the oppressed, but*ln the Lord*s is his refuge.
Oh,*pn that Israel’s deliverance would come from Zion! When*ln the Lord*s restores the fortunes of his people, let*ln Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
Psalm 15
A Description of the Godly
A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn who can dwell in your tent? Who*ln can live on your holy mountain?
The*pn one who lives blamelessly, practices righteousness, and*ln acknowledges the truth in his heart—
who*ln does not slander with his tongue, who*ln does not harm his friend or*ln discredit his neighbor,
who*ln despises the one rejected by the Lord*s but*ln honors those who fear the Lord,*s who*ln keeps his word whatever the cost,
who*ln does not lend his silver at interest or*ln take a bribe against the innocent— the*ln one who does these things will never be shaken.
Psalm 16
Confidence in the Lord
A Miktam of David.
Protect*pn me, God, for I take refuge in you.
I*ln said to the Lord,*s “You are my Lord; I*ln have nothing good besides you.”
As*ln for the holy people who are in the land, they*ln are the noble ones. All*ln my delight is in them.
The*ln sorrows of those who take another god for*ln themselves will multiply; I*ln will not pour out their drink offerings of blood, and*ln I will not speak their names with my lips.
Lord,*spn you are my portion and*ln my cup of blessing; you*ln hold my future.
The*ln boundary lines have fallen for me in*ln pleasant places; indeed,*ln I have a beautiful inheritance.
I*pn will bless the Lord*s who counsels me— even*ln at night when my thoughts trouble me.
I*ln always let the Lord*s guide me. Because*ln he is at my right hand, I*ln will not be shaken.
Therefore*pn my heart is glad and*ln my whole being rejoices; my*ln body also rests securely.
For*ln you will not abandon me to Sheol; you*ln will not allow your faithful one to see decay.
You*ln reveal the path of life to me; in*ln your presence is abundant joy; at*ln your right hand are eternal pleasures.
Psalm 17
A Prayer for Protection
A prayer of David.
Lord,*spn hear a just cause; pay*ln attention to my cry; listen*ln to my prayer — from*ln lips free of deceit.
Let*ln my vindication come from you, for*ln you see what is right.
You*ln have tested my heart; you*ln have examined me at night. You*ln have tried me and found nothing evil; I*ln have determined that my mouth will not sin.
Concerning*ln what people do: by*ln the words from your lips I*ln have avoided the ways of the violent.
My*ln steps are on your paths; my*ln feet have not slipped.
I*pn call on you, God, because*ln you will answer me; listen*ln closely to me; hear what I say.
Display*ln the wonders of your faithful love, Savior*ln of all who seek refuge from*ln those who rebel against your right hand.
Protect*ln me as the pupil of your eye; hide*ln me in the shadow of your wings
from*ln the wicked who treat me violently, my*ln deadly enemies who surround me.
They*pn are uncaring; their*ln mouths speak arrogantly.
They*ln advance against me; now they surround me. They*ln are determined to*ln throw me to the ground.
They*ln are like a lion eager to tear, like*ln a young lion lurking in ambush.
Rise*pn up, Lord!*s Confront*ln him; bring him down. With*ln your sword, save me from the wicked.

With*ln your hand, Lord,*s save me from men, from*ln men of the world whose*ln portion is in this life: You*ln fill their bellies with what you have in store; their*ln sons are satisfied, and*ln they leave their surplus to their children.
But*pn I will see your face in righteousness; when*ln I awake, I will be satisfied with your presence.
Psalm 18
Praise for Deliverance

For the choir director. Of the servant of the Lord, David, who spoke the words of this song to the Lord on the day the Lord rescued him from the grasp of all his enemies and from the power of Saul. He said:
I*pn love you, Lord,*s my strength.
The*ln Lord*s is my rock, my*ln fortress, and my deliverer, my*ln God, my rock where I seek refuge, my*ln shield and the horn of my salvation, my*ln stronghold.
I*ln called to the Lord,*s who is worthy of praise, and*ln I was saved from my enemies.
The*pn ropes of death were wrapped around me; the*ln torrents of destruction terrified me.
The*ln ropes of Sheol entangled me; the*ln snares of death confronted me.
I*ln called to the Lord*s in my distress, and*ln I cried to my God for help. From*ln his temple he heard my voice, and*ln my cry to him reached his ears.
Then*pn the earth shook and quaked; the*ln foundations of the mountains trembled; they*ln shook because he burned with anger.
Smoke*ln rose from his nostrils, and*ln consuming fire came from his mouth; coals*ln were set ablaze by it.
He*ln bent the heavens and came down, total*ln darkness beneath his feet.
He*ln rode on a cherub and flew, soaring*ln on the wings of the wind.
He*ln made darkness his hiding place, dark*ln storm clouds his canopy around him.
From*ln the radiance of his presence, his*ln clouds swept onward with hail and blazing coals.
The*ln Lord*s thundered from heaven; the*ln Most High made his voice heard.
He*ln shot his arrows and scattered them; he*ln hurled lightning bolts and routed them.
The*ln depths of the sea became visible, the*ln foundations of the world were exposed, at*ln your rebuke, Lord,*s at*ln the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
He*pn reached down from on high and*ln took hold of me; he*ln pulled me out of deep water.
He*ln rescued me from my powerful enemy and*ln from those who hated me, for*ln they were too strong for me.
They*ln confronted me in the day of my calamity, but*ln the Lord*s was my support.
He*ln brought me out to a spacious place; he*ln rescued me because he delighted in me.
The*pn Lord*s rewarded me according*ln to my righteousness; he*ln repaid me according*ln to the cleanness of my hands.
For*ln I have kept the ways of the Lord*s and*ln have not turned from my God to wickedness.
Indeed,*ln I let all his ordinances guide me and*ln have not disregarded his statutes.
I*ln was blameless toward him and*ln kept myself from my iniquity.
So*ln the Lord*s repaid me according*ln to my righteousness, according*ln to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
With*pn the faithful you*ln prove yourself faithful, with*ln the blameless you*ln prove yourself blameless,
with*ln the pure you*ln prove yourself pure, but*ln with the crooked you*ln prove yourself shrewd.
For*ln you rescue an oppressed people, but*ln you humble those with haughty eyes.
Lord,*sln you light my lamp; my*ln God illuminates my darkness.
With*ln you I can attack a barricade, and*ln with my God I can leap over a wall.
God -*pn his way is perfect; the*ln word of the Lord*s is pure. He*ln is a shield to all who take refuge in him.
For*ln who is God besides the Lord?*s And*ln who is a rock? Only our God.
God -*ln he clothes me with strength and*ln makes my way perfect.
He*ln makes my feet like the feet of a deer and*ln sets me securely on the heights.
He*ln trains my hands for war; my*ln arms can bend a bow of bronze.
You*ln have given me the shield of your salvation; your*ln right hand upholds me, and*ln your humility exalts me.
You*ln make a spacious place beneath me for my steps, and*ln my ankles do not give way.
I*pn pursue my enemies and overtake them; I*ln do not turn back until they are wiped out.
I*ln crush them, and they cannot get up; they*ln fall beneath my feet.
You*ln have clothed me with strength for battle; you*ln subdue my adversaries beneath me.
You*ln have made my enemies retreat before me; I*ln annihilate those who hate me.
They*ln cry for help, but there is no one to save them— they*ln cry to the Lord,*s but he does not answer them.
I*ln pulverize them like dust before the wind; I*ln trample them like mud in the streets.
You*pn have freed me from the feuds among the people; you*ln have appointed me the head of nations; a*ln people I had not known serve me.
Foreigners*ln submit to me cringing; as*ln soon as they hear they obey me.
Foreigners*ln lose heart and*ln come trembling from their fortifications.
The*pn Lord*s lives - blessed be my rock! The*ln God of my salvation is exalted.
God -*ln he grants me vengeance and*ln subdues peoples under me.
He*ln frees me from my enemies. You*ln exalt me above my adversaries; you*ln rescue me from violent men.
Therefore*ln I will give thanks to you among the nations, Lord;*s I*ln will sing praises about your name.
He*ln gives great victories to his king; he*ln shows loyalty to his anointed, to*ln David and his descendants forever.
Psalm 19
The Witness of Creation and Scripture
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
The*pn heavens declare the glory of God, and*ln the expanse proclaims the work of his hands.
Day*ln after day they pour out speech; night*ln after night they communicate knowledge.
There*ln is no speech; there are no words; their*ln voice is not heard.
Their*ln message has gone out to the whole earth, and*ln their words to the ends of the world. In*ln the heavens he has pitched a tent for the sun.
It*ln is like a bridegroom coming from his home; it*ln rejoices like an athlete running a course.
It*ln rises from one end of the heavens and*ln circles to their other end; nothing*ln is hidden from its heat.
The*pn instruction of the Lord*s is perfect, renewing*ln one’s life; the*ln testimony of the Lord*s is trustworthy, making*ln the inexperienced wise.
The*ln precepts of the Lord*s are right, making*ln the heart glad; the*ln command of the Lord*s is radiant, making*ln the eyes light up.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s is pure, enduring*ln forever; the*ln ordinances of the Lord*s are reliable and*ln altogether righteous.
They*ln are more desirable than gold — than*ln an abundance of pure gold; and*ln sweeter than honey dripping*ln from a honeycomb.
In*ln addition, your servant is warned by them, and*ln in keeping them there is an abundant reward.
Who*pn perceives his unintentional sins? Cleanse*ln me from my hidden faults.
Moreover,*ln keep your servant from willful sins; do*ln not let them rule me. Then*ln I will be blameless and*ln cleansed from blatant rebellion.
May*ln the words of my mouth and*ln the meditation of my heart be*ln acceptable to you, Lord,*sln my rock and my Redeemer.
Psalm 20
Deliverance in Battle
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
May*pn the Lord*s answer you in a day of trouble; may*ln the name of Jacob’s God protect you.
May*ln he send you help from the sanctuary and*ln sustain you from Zion.
May*ln he remember all your offerings and*ln accept your burnt offering. Selah*ig
May*pn he give you what your heart desires and*ln fulfill your whole purpose.
Let*ln us shout for joy at your victory and*ln lift the banner in the name of our God. May*ln the Lord*s fulfill all your requests.
Now*pn I know that the Lord*s gives victory to his anointed; he*ln will answer him from his holy heaven with*ln mighty victories from his right hand.
Some*ln take pride in chariots, and others in horses, but*ln we take pride in the name of the Lord*s our God.
They*ln collapse and fall, but*ln we rise and stand firm.
Lord,*sln give victory to the king! May*ln he answer us on the day that we call.
Psalm 21
The King’s Victory
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn the king finds joy in your strength. How*ln greatly he rejoices in your victory!
You*ln have given him his heart’s desire and*ln have not denied the request of his lips. Selah*ig
For*ln you meet him with rich blessings; you*ln place a crown of pure gold on his head.
He*ln asked you for life, and you gave it to him — length*ln of days forever and ever.
His*ln glory is great through your victory; you*ln confer majesty and splendor on him.
You*ln give him blessings forever; you*ln cheer him with joy in your presence.
For*ln the king relies on the Lord;*s through*ln the faithful love of the Most High he*ln is not shaken.
Your*pn hand will capture all your enemies; your*ln right hand will seize those who hate you.
